sentence.idiomatic: Today I took you to see so many amazing flowers--pretty impressive hey?
So this thing is used to swat flies with--that's pretty impressive.
I've heard that activity is really interesting. Next time you can bring me along to expand my horizons.
He is really interested in Chinese culture.
What topic are you most interested in?
I'm not really that interested in basketball, could we play something else?
The tour guide is giving us an introduction to the history of this house.
First watch the product presentation.
Can you introduce yourself a bit first?
It's so cold out today, you had better wear a thicker coat.
This book is too thick, I definitely can't finish it in one day.
Which kind do you want, thin or thick?
Do you know which city has the strongest winds?
What kind of a question is that?
I'll tell you, it's Chicago. Pretty impressive, hey?
Are you for real? I only know of the Chicago Bulls, not anything about it being windy.
In the past Chicago also had a lot of organized crime.
How come you're suddenly so interested in Chicago?
The other day I was watching a TV program, and they did a show on Chicago.
Oh right, I also know they have really thick pizza there.
It must be really delicious.
